column2: MICHIGAN DMV PRACTICE TEST
column6: MI

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column6: No trucks allowed
column8: One-way traffic

column2: 2. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column6: you must do it.
column8: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 3. This road sign:
column4: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column6: is a no-right-turns sign.
column8: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column10: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 4. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a narrow road ahead.
column8: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column10: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 5. What does this sign indicate?
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 6. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column6: Arrows
column8: Crosswalk Lines

column2: 7. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column6: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column8: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: Turn right or go through
column8: Flagger ahead

column2: 9. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 10. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column6: U-turns are not allowed.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 11. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column6: that there's a school zone ahead.
column8: the direction they should travel.

column2: 12. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: look for a human flagger.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 13. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column6: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column10: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.

column2: 14. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column6: protect
column8: work with

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column6: Do not turn right.
column8: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 16. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column6: decrease the following distance.
column8: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column6: Merge
column8: Crossroad

column2: 18. Roads are most slippery:
column6: on hills.
column8: just before it rains.
column10: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 19. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column8: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line

column2: 20. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: be alert and obey all traffic signals.
column6: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column8: look both ways before crossing the tracks.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column6: You must make a complete stop
column8: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles

column2: 22. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column6: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.
column8: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column10: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.

column2: 23. This sign is a:
column6: warning sign.
column8: regulatory sign.

column2: 24. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: the lane to the left may pass.
column6: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column8: passing is permitted in either direction.
column10: the lane to the right may pass.

column2: 25. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 26. The sign in the picture:
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column10: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 27. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 28. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column8: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column10: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.

column2: 29. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column6: that a reversible lane starts.
column8: that a divided highway ends

column2: 30. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column6: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column10: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.

column2: 31. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: Pull the steering wheel back.
column8: Turn on your cruise control.
column10: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 32. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 33. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column6: Yes, except for school zones.
column8: No.
column10: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 34. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column6: No U-Turn
column8: Slippery when wet

column2: 36. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column6: Tranquilizers.
column8: A cold remedy.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrian crossing
column8: Low ground railroad crossing

column2: 38. This road sign means:
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: Steep grade ahead

column2: 39. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column6: at a yield sign.
column8: on an up-hill.

column2: 40. This sign indicates that:
column4: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column6: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column8: there is a school zone after the curve.
column10: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

column2: 41. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 42. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column10: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 43. This road sign means:
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 44. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column6: sound your horn.
column8: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.

column2: 45. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column8: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 46. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column6: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: try your emergency lights.
column10: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 47. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column6: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column10: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.

column2: 48. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column6: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column8: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05

column2: 49. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column6: Braking distance.
column8: Perception time.

column2: 50. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: No, never.
column8: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column10: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
